results.title: Leaving Tropeoulhos
results.creator_credit: Anastasia Solomidis and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Anastasia and her husband lived in a village in Greece. One day a government official arrived to ask whether they would consider migrating to Australia. They talked about it and decided that they had better take up this opportunity to improve their lives and provide opportunities for their children.
results.description: Anastasia and her husband lived in a village in Greece. One day a government official arrived to ask whether they would consider migrating to Australia. They talked about it and decided that they had better take up this opportunity to improve their lives and provide opportunities for their children.

results.title: River of my Life
results.creator_credit: Amira Sabanovic and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: A digital story made as part of the ‘Diversity @ Work’ Program in association with AMES, Australia Post and SBS. Amira describes the course her life has taken - from the ravages of War in her homeland through to the hardships of a refugee’s life in both Europe and Australia before finding acceptance and fulfillment through a supportive workplace.

results.title: Thirty years destroyed
results.brief_description: In this scripted drama, a mad scientist realises his life’s work - with deathly consequences. Borrows from classic horror movies of the period to irresistable effect.

results.title: Memories
results.brief_description: Memories of the early years of Moomba, particularly of the pageant and my involvement in those early years. A digital story created to celebrate 50 years of Melbourne Moomba Water Fest.

results.title: I live again
results.brief_description: A moving story of how one man’s life was completely turned inside out when he suffered a stroke resulting in a loss of hearing. With subtitles.

results.title: From Graz to Glenroy
results.creator_credit: Elfrieda Senycia, Viv Mehes and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: This story explores the journey of migration from Austria to Australia for Elfrida and her husband. As they rebuild life in a new country they deal with triumps and disappointments including the humiliation of never having their qualifications recognised in Australia.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Elfrieda Senycia, Viv Mehes and ACMI Digital Storytelling

results.title: Rabbit Control [Part 1: Poisoning with 1080]
results.creator_credit: Ian Blythman, John Atkins and Conservation Forests and Lands
results.brief_description: This program narrated by Maurie Fields shows the problem of pest control in rural Victoria, and the adverse effects on farming if rabbit populations are not controlled. Part 1 explains the proper steps and procedure in using the poison 1080, the various safety precautions, equipment and supplies and tidy up details.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian Blythman, John Atkins and Conservation Forests and Lands
results.description: This program narrated by Maurie Fields shows the problem of pest control in rural Victoria, and the adverse effects on farming if rabbit populations are not controlled. Part 1 explains the proper steps and procedure in using the poison 1080, the various safety precautions, equipment and supplies and tidy up details.

results.title: Don't tell me I can't
results.creator_credit: Krystyna Popczyk and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: This is a daughter’s dedication to her mother. Krystina’s mother managed a vision and hearing impairment with great courage and a ‘don’t tell me I can’t’ attitude.
results.description: This is a daughter’s dedication to her mother. Krystina’s mother managed a vision and hearing impairment with great courage and a ‘don’t tell me I can’t’ attitude.

results.title: Culture, respect and law
results.brief_description: Collin Walker Snr, a Yorta Yorta elder, tells of mission life and living in Echuca. This story was produced in one of ACMI’s regional workshops conducted in partnership with the Njernda Aboriginal Corporation and funded by VicHealth.
